intro: Dischidia listerophora, commonly known as the silver vine, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and fleshy, oval-shaped leaves. The leaves are typically covered in a dense layer of fine, silvery hairs, giving the plant its common name. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by berries that are reddish when mature. This plant is often grown as an ornamental due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in a variety of conditions.
